result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lance J Meidl

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Mai
Case Called: 9:19 am 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo 
Defendant appears in person, in custody and without counsel. 
INCLUDE CASES: 22CF1235 & 22CF1236 
Date and time set for preliminary hearing. 

Court questions defendant regarding counsel representation. 
Defendant wishes to waive time limits. Court accepts waiver. 

DATES: as previously set 
Bond Continues; 
C: Branch 5
Adj: 9:25 am

Clerk: Amanda.
Cases called at 10:07 am. 
INCLUDES: 22CF69, 22CF179, 22CF366, 22CF367, 22CF808, 22CF1235, 22CF1236, 22CM34, 22CM296.
State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Lacey Coonen.  Defendant appears from MCJ, and with Attorney Francisco Araiza via telephone. 
VRCW. 

Attorney Araiza notes he is not representing defendant on the two newest files. 
SPD is currently looking for new representation for defendant; 

Defendant states there was an offer previously made by the State and wishes to proceed with it. 

NEXT DATES>>

Plea/Sentencing: 12/20 at 2:40 pm. 
JT: 2/15 at 9:00 am.

Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 1:12 pm. 
INCLUDES: 22CF1235 & 22CF1236.

Date and time set for review re: public defender representation prior to preliminary hearing. 
Deft. fails to appear. Court notes deft. is incarcerated in Lincoln Co Jail - waives appearance for today's hearing.
Court notes counsel has not yet been appointed; has Atty Francisco Araiza on other open cases. 
Prelim set for 10/31/2022 to remain on calendar. 

Adj: 1:14 pm.

Review hearing on October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing on October 31, 2022 at 09:10 am.

INCLUDES 22CF1235, 22CF1236: No contact with victim(s): Check Into Cash, Jack of All Services, LLC, D.M.G., E.K.M. and W.A.T.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
